data.title: Spiralia
data.solution:
# This program can be used to make test cases:
# https://pastebin.com/vCxG2PcA


import math

# Read the integer N
n = int(input())

# Read the grid into 2D array
a = [input() for i in range(n)]

for i in range(math.ceil(n/2)):
    # Characters going along the top
    print(a[i][i : n-i], end='')
    
    # Characters going down the right side
    print(*[*zip(*a)][-i-1][i+1 : n-i], sep='', end='')
    
    # Characters going along the bottom
    print(a[-i-1][::-1][i+1 : n-i], end='')
    
    # Characters going up the left side
    print(*[*zip(*a)][i][::-1][i+1 : n-i-1], sep='', end='')

# Newline is not needed but whatever
print()
data.statement:
A message is encoded in a square [[N]] by [[N]] grid. The first character of the message is in the top-left corner of the grid and the remaining characters are placed in the grid in an inwards clockwise spiral pattern.

Decode the message.

testCases.testOut: You're spending too much time reading this test case output! Stop reading this and write code. If you're finished writing your code, please submit it. There is no secret within this message that I have intentionally put in here. I am being serious. Stop reading this message. Do not wander in these desolate wastes, for these lands have nothing to offer you. Just so you know, there is actually no cipher here. It's not a skip cipher or one of those stupid ciphers where you take the first letter from every word and string them together. This is filler so the message contains exactly six hundred and twenty-five characters!

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> One integer [[N]], the side length of the square grid.
<<Next [[N]] Lines:>> [[N]] characters on each line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A message is encoded in a square N by N grid. The first character of the message is in the top-left corner of the grid and the remaining characters are placed in the grid in an inwards clockwise spiral pattern.

Decode the message.
Input
Line 1: One integer N, the side length of the square grid.
Next N Lines: N characters on each line.
Output
Line 1: The decoded message.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 25
Example
Input
3
Cod
mei
aGn
Output
CodinGame
